00020 /**
00021  * @file   VerboseErrHandler.h
00022  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00023  * @date   Mon Jun 26 12:26:18 PDT 2006
00024  * 
00025  * @brief Basic error handler that uses Verbose::warn() and dies by either throwing an
00026  * exception or calling abort()
00027  */
00028 
00029 #ifndef VERBOSEERRHANDLER_H
00030 #define VERBOSEERRHANDLER_H
00031 
00032 #include "util/ErrHandler.h"
00033 #include "util/Except.h"
00034 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00035 //
00036 #include <cstring>
00037 #include <string>
00038 //
00039 
00040 /**
00041  * @brief Basic error handler that prints to cerr and dies by either throwing an
00042  * exception or calling abort()
00043  */
00044 class VerboseErrHandler : public ErrHandler {
00045 
00046 public:
00047   VerboseErrHandler(bool doThrow=false, 
00048                                         bool verbose=true,
00049                                         bool exitOnError=true,
00050                                         int  exitOnErrorValue=-1) {
00051     m_Throw = doThrow;
00052     m_Verbose = verbose;
00053     m_ExitOnError = exitOnError;
00054     m_ExitOnErrorValue = exitOnErrorValue;
00055   }
00056 
00057   /** Virtual destructor for a virtual class. */
00058   virtual ~VerboseErrHandler() {}
00059 
00060   /** 
00061    * When something terminal happens this function is called. This is
00062    * the place to do any last minute cleanup, log writing, and
00063    * communication with the user about what went wrong. The
00064    * implementation of this function should either exit the program or
00065    * throw an exception.
00066    * 
00067    * @param msg - Message about what went wrong.
00068    */
00069   virtual void handleError(const std::string &msg) {
00070   if(m_Verbose){
00071         Verbose::out(1, msg);
00072         }
00073         
00074         if (m_ExitOnError) {    
00075                 #ifdef _WIN32
00076                 // windows needs time for the other process to run, yeild to it.
00077                 Sleep(500);
00078                 #endif
00079                 exit(m_ExitOnErrorValue);
00080         }
00081 
00082   if (m_Throw) {
00083     throw Except(msg);
00084   }
00085 
00086   // We shouldnt hit here; We should be exiting or rethrowing the error.
00087   // If we do, then something is wrong.
00088   // abort(1);
00089   }
00090 
00091   /** Will this error handler be throwing exceptions? */
00092   virtual bool getThrows() { return m_Throw; }
00093 
00094   /** Will this error handler be throwing exceptions? */
00095   virtual void setThrows(bool doThrow) { m_Throw= doThrow; }
00096 
00097 private:
00098   bool m_Throw;          ///< Determines if we throw an exception or just call abort()
00099   bool m_Verbose;        ///< Determines if we call Verbose::out
00100   bool m_ExitOnError;    ///< Determines if overriding default value to return when exiting on error
00101   int  m_ExitOnErrorValue;  ///< Value to set if setting the value to return when exiting on errors
00102 };
00103 
00104 
00105 #endif /* VERBOSEERRHANDLER_H */
